page.title: 17FORESTRY
page.content: The{Abercairney Estate}covers around 20,000 acres of land. A large section of this is given to{forestry which is a profitable part of the Estate. There are 2 full-time foresters. Part of their job is to re-plant so many trees every year. Wood such as {silver birch, Douglas fir, Scots pine and{Spruce}are used. New trees are planted approximately 5 feet apart and then thinned as they grow. Mature timber is sent to the Estate sawmill where it is used for general repair work. Some trees are sent to Edinburgh at{Christmas}for sale, although this is the largest outside sale the Estate has for its wood.
